alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 13 at 9:11PM CDT until June 14 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Mitchell County in north central Kansas... * Until 315 AM CDT Wednesday. * At 911 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rural areas just north of Hunter. This includes the following streams and drainages... North Branch Spillman Creek, Bacon Creek, Little Salt Creek, Walnut Creek, Carr Creek, Rock Creek, Salt Creek and West Rock Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
